thread.title: Rupesh Shah shines at world billiard championship
thread.title_full: Rupesh Shah shines at world billiard championship - The Times of India

author: Shweta Singh
title: Rupesh Shah shines at world billiard championship
text:
AHMEDABAD: He is Ahmedabad's own legend in cue sports. Ahmedabad's triple world billiards champion Rupesh Shah settled for a bronze medal in the time-format of the world billiards championship played in Australia. Shah was knocked out by compatriot and defending champion Pankaj Advani in four hours semi-final encounter.
This is for the first time that Shah has won a medal in time-format at worlds.
Arjuna awardee Rupesh was never allowed by Advani to come close to his points as Advani maintained his lead throughout the match. Advani continued scoring reasonable breaks at regular interval and later scored breaks of 205, 205 and 397 to widen the gap between him and Rupesh.
There was a chance when Rupesh could have made a big break and put pressure on Advani he failed to convert that chance into big break and faltered after scoring 105.
The ONGC employee continues to impress on the green baize. And hopes to pocket a few more world titles before he calls it a day.
